Package edu.guilford

Class Creature

java.lang.Object
edu.guilford.Creature
Direct Known Subclasses:
Critter, Plant
public abstract class Creature extends Object
A class that represents a creature in the simulation
Version:
2/19/24
Author:
A. Fuad
See Also:
  • Critter
  • Plant

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected int
    age
    An integer that is the number of days the object has been alive; it is alway initialized to zero
    protected boolean
    alive
    A boolean with true meaning alive and false meaning dead; is initialized to true when the object is instantiated
    protected float
    rate
    A floating-point number that is the current rate of growth of the object (in grams/day)
    protected float
    size
    A positive floating-point number that is the current size of the object (in grams)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Creature(float size, float rate)
    A constructor that initializes the size and rate of the object to the specified values and sets alive to true and age to zero

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    changeSize(float amount)
    Changes the value of size by a specified amount; if size is less than or equal to zero, then the object invokes die() and alive is set to False
    void
    die()
    Makes an object "dead" by setting size and rate to 0 and setting alive to False.
    int
    getAge()
    A getter for age
    float
    getRate()
    A getter for rate
    float
    getSize()
    A getter for size
    boolean
    isAlive()
    A getter for the value of alive
    void
    setRate(float rate)
    A setter for size
    void
    simulateDay()
    Simulates one day of growth for the object by changing the size and increasing the age by one

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • size

      protected float size
      A positive floating-point number that is the current size of the object (in grams)

    • rate

      protected float rate
      A floating-point number that is the current rate of growth of the object (in grams/day)

    • alive

      protected boolean alive
      A boolean with true meaning alive and false meaning dead; is initialized to true when the object is instantiated

    • age

      protected int age
      An integer that is the number of days the object has been alive; it is alway initialized to zero

  • Constructor Details

    • Creature

      public Creature(float size, float rate)
      A constructor that initializes the size and rate of the object to the specified values and sets alive to true and age to zero
      Parameters:
      size - the initial size of the object (in g)
      rate - the initial rate of growth of the object (in g/day)

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public float getSize()
      A getter for size
      Returns:
      the current value of size (in g)

    • getRate

      public float getRate()
      A getter for rate
      Returns:
      the current value of rate (in g/day)

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      A getter for the value of alive
      Returns:
      the current value of alive (true or false)

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      A getter for age
      Returns:
      the current value of age (in days)

    • setRate

      public void setRate(float rate)
      A setter for size
      Parameters:
      size - the new value of size (in g)

    • changeSize

      public void changeSize(float amount)
      Changes the value of size by a specified amount; if size is less than or equal to zero, then the object invokes die() and alive is set to False
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount by which to change the size (in g)

    • simulateDay

      public void simulateDay()
      Simulates one day of growth for the object by changing the size and increasing the age by one

    • die

      public void die()
      Makes an object "dead" by setting size and rate to 0 and setting alive to False.
